Change-Id: Ie05efcf2e05389b5194a034c8d89b0c3ba7b350c
"}]
commit_message:
Use OpenStack-Infra MariaDB mirror in OpenStack-CI

When executing tests within OpenStack-CI, the MariaDB
mirror implemented in OpenStack-Infra will be used
instead of the Rackspace mirror.

This should speed up OpenStack-CI testing and be more
reliable as it eliminates external dependencies and
does not rely on a single mirror as a source.

For the sake of record, the MariaDB mirror was
implemented in OpenStack-Infra with these reviews:

- https://review.openstack.org/307831
- https://review.openstack.org/354203
- https://review.openstack.org/440769

Notes:
As the MariaDB packages are installed across many
roles through the use of a meta-dependency, and some
of those executions are not done by playbooks in the
tests repository the detection of the URL has been
put into a bash environment variable and the test-vars
are set to look that up if it's set. This makes the
overrides more universal and yet still only apply
if the test is executed in nodepool.

Also, the lxc_container_template_* variables are not
used anywhere any more (since Newton), so they've
just been removed entirely.

Change-Id: Ie05efcf2e05389b5194a034c8d89b0c3ba7b350c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/00/442100/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Set the MariaDB repo URL based on discovered information set_fact: galera_repo_url: "{{ ubuntu_repo_url.stdout | netorigin }}/ubuntu-mariadb/10.1" galera_client_apt_repo_url: "{{ ubuntu_repo_url.stdout | netorigin }}/ubuntu-mariadb/10.1" when: - ansible_pkg_mgr == 'apt' - nodepool_dir.stat.exists

commit_message:
Uncap sphinx version

Sphinx version has been capped since
I9c45d239e156ec4fb49b5d8bd2404b66155be92b
in order to fix an issue with resolving citations.

Then, in I7e55dcf910e0ba6dd85b565db8cb1ecbdd39634a,
the issue has been fixed by modifying citation references.

So uncap sphinx version.
But sphinx 1.6.1 has another issue (*1),
so leave sphinx 1.6.1 in the blacklist.

*1: https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/3754

Change-Id: I09acc562bc37edc3c8a40027f7eb359aaa956c32

commit_message:
Avoid retrieving IP from a bridge without IP

In some cases, bridges are defined without static IP address.
This patch checks if the bridge has an IP, otherwise skip to the next
method to determine node IP.

Change-Id: I2c79f7dde5b820ae02a6ed09dbb59e690055f5f8
Closes-Bug: #1695274

commit_message:
Fix buildimage jobs to use new process

When switching to new yaml based image builds, the delorean
settings are no longer used, because the delorean-repo element
is not included on the images.
Instead, we need to configure the repos on the host, and export
them using DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF var

Change-Id: I1b76cb0bea8dbef37489409eecbb7075abe75934

This implements the resize in a more "vagrant way", by using a
plugin that is meant for resizing the instance's disk.

Advantages:
- We don't have to ship the resize code contnet
- It works when stopping the machine and starting it up again.

Change-Id: I4f725131f15c57f176201aac0d967459792ebe5a
(cherry picked from commit 407002f3f7a5ef3ac6951d00a2f42992c841208a)
'}]
commit_message:
Vagrantfile resize handling

This implements the resize in a more "vagrant way", by using a
plugin that is meant for resizing the instance's disk.

Advantages:
- We don't have to ship the resize code contnet
- It works when stopping the machine and starting it up again.

Change-Id: I4f725131f15c57f176201aac0d967459792ebe5a
(cherry picked from commit 407002f3f7a5ef3ac6951d00a2f42992c841208a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/58/469158/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ib0cbde725ea79d91d3292f8367d876eb3bca4256

commit_message:
Policy in code for packages

This commit implements policy in code for packages
API. The default rules for the packages API were
removed from the policy.json and moved into code under
murano.common.policies.env_template.

This commit specifically:
  - Moves policy actions related to the packages
    API from the policy.json into code.
  - Documents the API information and paths associated with
    each package policy.

Partially Implements: blueprint policy-in-code
Change-Id: I9a091606bec7c74ce7cf53fd327a2a40c6b9c364

commit_message:
Remove neutron ml2 plugin linuxbridge mechanism_driver

We have since long set the following in hieradata.
 neutron_mechanism_drivers: openvswitch

But I cannot see neutron_mechanism_drivers being a parameter anywhere.

It looks like we intended not to have linuxbridge loaded, but
it has been included since it is the default in neutron::plugins::ml2.

Change-Id: Icd745fb6e670345d949fcc70f1ac02bdd5a55d40

commit_message:
Fix cinder-api ubuntu binary

This changes moves cinder-api to make use of apache to launch
its processes.
Ubuntu binary removed support in Ocata for cinder-api system
services [1].
At this moment cinder in Ocata branch is not working at all
due this issue.
This changes aims to fix cinder in master only for ubuntu binary
with the purpose of make a clean backport to stable/ocata without
do any other change on the backport process.

A follow up change will migrate other OS/install_type to make use of
Apache but only changing master branch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/111069.html

Change-Id: I86ae3ec899e9b7b1ad9f727b9b9bb3549738f944
Closes-Bug: #1676751
(cherry picked from commit d14aadd65dc4d3658777ea5c5878197013a82e92)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/52/458152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ "${KOLLA_INSTALL_TYPE}" == "binary" ]]; then if [[ "${KOLLA_BASE_DISTRO}" =~ debian|ubuntu ]]; then # Loading Apache2 ENV variables . /etc/apache2/envvars rm -rf /var/run/apache2/* APACHE_DIR="apache2" else rm -rf /var/run/httpd/* /run/httpd/* /tmp/httpd* APACHE_DIR="httpd" fi fi

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

In addition, changing Popen to check_output because
check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if the called process
returns a non-zero return code.
It also makes the code look much better.

Change-Id: If01f08216b4b252bd31029913e83fe945bf76866
Closes-Bug:#1693670
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-keystoneclient refs/changes/58/470658/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: @mock.patch.object(rpc, 'get_server') def test_start_servers(self, mock_get_server): endpoints = [test.MatchType(FakeInterCellRPCDispatcher)] rpcserver = mock.MagicMock() mock_get_server.return_value = rpcserver expected_mock_get_server_called_list = [] expected_mock_get_server_called_list.append( mock.call(target, endpoints=endpoints)) rpcserver.start.assert_called_with() self.assertEqual(expected_mock_get_server_called_list, mock_get_server.call_args_list) self.assertEqual(len(messaging.MessageRunner.get_message_types()), rpcserver.start.call_count) self.assertEqual(len(messaging.MessageRunner.get_message_types()), mock_get_server.call_count) # rpcclient = self.mox.CreateMockAnything() rpcclient = mock.MagicMock() with mock.patch.object(rpcapi, '_get_client', return_value=rpcclient) as mock_get_client: self.driver.send_message_to_cell(cell_state, message) mock_get_client.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY, 'cells.intercell.targeted') # mimic mox.Func(check_transport_url), maybe we should add a # add a new util function in nova.test self.assertTrue( check_transport_url(mock_get_client.call_args[0][0])) rpcclient.cast.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'process_message', message=message.to_json()) # rpcclient = self.mox.CreateMockAnything() rpcclient = mock.MagicMock() rpcclient.prepare.return_value = rpcclient with mock.patch.object(rpcapi, '_get_client', return_value=rpcclient) as mock_get_client: self.driver.send_message_to_cell(cell_state, message) self.assertTrue( check_transport_url(mock_get_client.call_args[0][0])) mock_get_client.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'cells.intercell.targeted') rpcclient.prepare.assert_called_once_with(fanout=True) rpcclient.cast.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, 'process_message', message=message.to_json()) rpcclient = mock.MagicMock() with mock.patch.object(rpcapi, '_get_client', return_value=rpcclient) as mock_get_client: self.driver.send_message_to_cell(cell_state, message) self.assertTrue( check_transport_url(mock_get_client.call_args[0][0])) mock_get_client.assert_called_once_with( mock.ANY,'cells.intercell42.fake-message-type') rpcclient.prepare.assert_called_once_with(fanout=True)

commit_message:
Update tracing in block_device_create_config_file

Something seems to be going on with the ppc matching in the gate test.
Small updates to see what's going on...

Change-Id: Ie48cd4ce1f983a58932a577a43746240f6866936
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/63/471163/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # nosiy; we manually trace local xtrace xtrace=$(set +o | grep xtrace) set +o xtrace local config_yaml="$1" cp $(echo ${DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG} | cut -c 8-) ${config_yaml} echo "Using file-based block-device config: ${DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG}" printf "%s" "${DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG}" >${config_yaml} echo "User specified block-device config from DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG" # Search the elements for a matching block-device config. # XXX: first match wins? echo "Searching elements for block-device[-${ARCH}].yaml ..." local cfg # look for arch specific version first, then default cfg=${image_elements[$i]}/block-device-${ARCH}.yaml if [ -e ${cfg} ]; then cp ${cfg} ${config_yaml} echo "Using block-device config: ${cfg}" return cfg=${image_elements[$i]}/block-device-default.yaml if [ -e ${cfg} ]; then cp ${cfg} ${config_yaml} echo "Using block-device config: ${cfg}" return echo "... done" # how did this get here? if [ -e ${config_yaml} ]; then die "${config_yaml} exists?" fi echo "Using default block-device fallback config" cat >${config_yaml} <<EOF $xtrace
deleted_lines: local CONFIG_YAML="$1" # User setting overwrites this cp $(echo ${DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG} | cut -c 8-) ${CONFIG_YAML} printf "%s" "${DIB_BLOCK_DEVICE_CONFIG}" >${CONFIG_YAML} local BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH=${image_elements[$i]}/block-device-${ARCH}.yaml if [ -e ${BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH} ]; then cp ${BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH} ${CONFIG_YAML} BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH=${image_elements[$i]}/block-device-default.yaml if [ -e ${BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH} ]; then cp ${BLOCK_DEVICE_CFG_PATH} ${CONFIG_YAML} if [ ! -e ${CONFIG_YAML} ]; then cat >${CONFIG_YAML} <<EOF

commit_message:
Add compute inventory precheck

With nova cells_v2 at least one compute node is required in
inventory to deploy nova.

This change add prechecks to ensure at least 1 compute is present.

Change-Id: I242518ad3bd149ad245515299301777f6b3bdd08
Closes-Bug: #1686410
(cherry picked from commit fee4eee0be654c82edd2f9c5a6e4eb90ee9eb990)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/69/461669/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Checking available compute nodes in inventory fail: msg: "At least 1 compute node required in inventory" when: groups['compute'] | length < 1

subject: Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-04 04:56:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth/commit/62541cc2bda790e4134a3489574db6343dd36c69', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to check_output to make it consistent
with keystone [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/

Change-Id: I126579da6cbdacfdbaed80ef968e43e0829e24e1
Closes-Bug:#1693670

commit_message:
Parse roles from roles_data.yaml directly

roles_data.yaml is the source of truth for the roles available in a
deployment.

Change-Id: I599bf5675caa4650a8eb647e8c50e0fc64fdc923
Implements blueprint: get-roles-action

added_lines: Parses roles_data.yaml and returns the names of all available roles. roles_data = yaml.safe_load(oc.get_object( self.container, constants.OVERCLOUD_J2_ROLES_NAME)[1]) except Exception as err: err_msg = ("Error retrieving roles data from deployment plan: %s" % err) for role in roles_data: roles.append(role['name'])
deleted_lines: Parses overcloud.yaml and returns the Heat resources where type = OS::Heat::ResourceGroup mc = self.get_workflow_client(context) mistral_env = mc.environments.get(self.container) template_name = mistral_env.variables['template'] resources = yaml.safe_load( oc.get_object(self.container, template_name)[1])['resources'] except Exception as mistral_err: err_msg = ("Error retrieving deployment plan: %s" % mistral_err) for resource, details in resources.items(): if details['type'] == constants.RESOURCE_GROUP_TYPE: roles.append(resource)

commit_message:
Grafana post_config checks only need to run locally

Recently added post_config for Grafana does some uri queries,
these can be problematic if run across every node.

commit_message:
Replace messaging.get_transport with get_rpc_transport

The get_transport method was deprecated in the oslo.messaging
5.24.2 release in favor of get_rpc_transport and
get_notification_transport. We are already using get_notification_transport,
we just need to change to use get_rpc_transport.

Change-Id: I6fd8f4a23a15f93029edd2b13723266581fffe3f

commit_message:
Add delorean-repo element to centos

This element was being set by python-tripleoclient when using
the legacy build, relying on the USE_DELOREAN_TRUNK flag. But
with the new build based on yaml, this step is totally ignoring,
causing repos to don't be configured if this element is missing.
Add it for the centos builds, as they fail without this.

Change-Id: If1e04c7f0af56986a6370bea35cf6465e29ad1be
Depends-On: Ieea596195625f5e6fb902ae8403bfe705ebedeed

commit_message:
Change Amphora image size to be 3 by default

'2' will fail for RHEL.

We should use default that will work for common distros.

Change-Id: I35291773a0d0fc32eff1a25e03595009fd243a5f

commit_message:
Use a def instend of a lambda expression.

A pep8 warnning "E731 do not assign a lambda expression, use a def"
appeared at a line with a lambda expression.

So use a def instend of that lambda expression.

Change-Id: I6a44ff54a9c8dccb8fcbb60101adcfa7d18a5c08

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-17 11:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/4a47c309ae1f312119e390e60d191c7d9f0e67ee', 'message': 'Label changes to True/False from UP/DOWN when an error occurred in firewall form.

In firewall creating form, I forgot to choose a policy and click
button "Add", then the form page reappeared with an error message,
that's quite normal. But look at the field "Admin State", it has
changed to be True/False, however, it should be UP/DOWN.

ThemableChoiceField is not good at handling choices with boolean
keys, to avoid that problem, I think use choices with string keys
would be better.

Change-Id: Ic565665b529a27be415f3d0b30009f544e290707
Closes-Bug: #1691446
'}]
commit_message:
Label changes to True/False from UP/DOWN when an error occurred in firewall form.

In firewall creating form, I forgot to choose a policy and click
button "Add", then the form page reappeared with an error message,
that's quite normal. But look at the field "Admin State", it has
changed to be True/False, however, it should be UP/DOWN.

ThemableChoiceField is not good at handling choices with boolean
keys, to avoid that problem, I think use choices with string keys
would be better.

Change-Id: Ic565665b529a27be415f3d0b30009f544e290707
Closes-Bug: #1691446

commit_message:
jenkins: propose_update.sh: Use a single active repository for testing

Previously, we used a retired repo to verify that the job will not do
any updates on repositories which have no matching files. We now change
that to a single active repository to confirm that the job is working
properly under normal conditions.

Change-Id: I0617090370eed20676239490c0846b4e28ce6812

commit_message:
Add Multinode gate for OpenStack-Helm project

This patch set adds a gate to support multinode operation for
OpenStack-Helm project. Three nodes are required to form a proper
quorum for Ceph, and allow Neutron to operate with H/A Agents.

Once stabilized the 2 node check will be removed.

Change-Id: I9ad44946963e059e2b0620d1a5cad946f3399f11

commit_message:
do not use the remote prefix name for release notes scans

Leave the remote name out of the branch specifier for new release notes
pages to allow local dev/test builds to work. Reno will search for a
remote branch if it does not find a local branch with the name given.

Change-Id: If85133edcc45d6fc9c7fcca6fc45c647ba5f20a1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
vmware-nsx: return check-requirements to gating

Commit 9c31cea841da713f41d15101c7bf6d78c65ef61f removed this due to
conflitcs with the vmware-nsxlib library. This has been resolved
and we would like to enforce this on gating.

commit_message:
Switch to bash script for getting tempest plugin list

While calling python script for getting tempest plugin list,
the tempest-plugin-sanity job got failed due to missing requests
python package. So, in order to overcome this failure, we can
switch to shell script

Change-Id: I472e68c495b7ae00654b2f2b5951c43835af1427

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: Iba545498787bc7e829cd43f035935cc4eebd3669
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Add the support for 'detail' flag

Magnum API supports a 'detail' flag to show the list
of cluster templates with details but that was not supported
at client.
So this patch adds the support for cluster-template-list command.

Change-Id: I7df73aae1c489132aaf091d162b1d081e65f09c7
Partial-Bug: #1674314
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient refs/changes/20/452520/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sort_key=None, detail=False): expected_args['detail'] = detail def test_cluster_template_list_success_detailed(self, mock_list): self._test_arg_success('cluster-template-list ' '--detail') expected_args = self._get_expected_args_list(detail=True) mock_list.assert_called_once_with(**expected_args) @mock.patch( 'magnumclient.v1.cluster_templates.ClusterTemplateManager.list')

subject: Add a keep-output flag for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 01:48:06.000000000', 'files': ['tests/run_functests.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/3886d5e2062c42619757555a0fce34d7ed2ee5f7', 'message': 'Add a keep-output flag for functional tests

Add a -k flag that disables deleting of of ${destdir} for tests.  This

Change-Id: I107c33e70100b21495a807f10762d3b6babe9bfe
'}]
commit_message:
Add a keep-output flag for functional tests

Add a -k flag that disables deleting of of ${destdir} for tests.  This
should allow examination of the resulting images if required.

Change-Id: I107c33e70100b21495a807f10762d3b6babe9bfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/32/471532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${KEEP_OUTPUT} -ne 1 ]]; then trap "rm -rf $dest_dir" EXIT fi rm -f /tmp/dib-test-should-fail if [[ ${KEEP_OUTPUT} -ne 1 ]]; then # reset trap and cleanup trap EXIT rm -rf $dest_dir fiKEEP_OUTPUT=0 echo " -k : keep output directories" k) KEEP_OUTPUT=1 ;;

commit_message:
Replace oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Function 'oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()' is deprecated in version '1.6'
and will be removed in a future version. We use
datetime.datetime.isoformat() instead. For more informations:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.utils/api/timeutils.html#oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

Change-Id: I6ed014c35116243a0e8a61365ec64855600478a2

commit_message:
revise documents releated to batch policy

this patch revises documents releated to batch policy since it will
not support CLUSTER_DELETE anymore.

Change-Id: I13e04a4a082cb3436c5c4119d9c603032979ee41
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/56/470656/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is enforced when cluster is updated. The development team is still looking for an elegant solution that can regulate the resource creation requests.in each batch. This property is mainly used to ensure that batch requests are still within the processing capability of a backend service.
deleted_lines: is enforced when cluster is updated or deleted. The development team is still looking for an elegant solution that can regulate the resource creation requests.or deleted in each batch. This property is mainly used to ensure that batch requests are still within the processing capability of a backend service.

subject: Create PReP boot partition for PPC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-21 00:21:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/97f6527f86a6721c8b7ed8c890cd7edbb17446c0', 'message': "Create PReP boot partition for PPC

It seems that during the transition to the new block device layer we
dropped the PPC setup of a PReP boot partition which is required to
install grub.

This adds back a branch to set a PPC default.  To make it a bit easier
to edit the YAML files with an editor and make it a bit clearer what's
going onI have moved them into separate files we can source.

Change-Id: I49c2085a65afffd4f9f00694dbdba49ea10d44eb
Closes-Bug: #1674402

commit_message:
Create PReP boot partition for PPC

It seems that during the transition to the new block device layer we
dropped the PPC setup of a PReP boot partition which is required to
install grub.

As described in the bug, it seems "grub-install" only works on
/dev/mapper nodes for PPC (it probes for a PReP partition, and this
probing has different code-paths depending on the install location.
This may well be a bug in grub ...)

After looking closer, there seems to be no reason to not generically
use the devicemapper nodes.  This calls kpartx unconditionally and
modifies the return values to be the /dev/mapper nodes.

Change-Id: I49c2085a65afffd4f9f00694dbdba49ea10d44eb
Closes-Bug: #1674402

commit_message:
Replace assertTrue(isinstance()) with assertIsInstance()

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I53a368ddb6b0b810e85eaedf42bc05e729a0e511
Closes-Bug: #1268480

commit_message:
Use Jinja2 sandbox environment

Jinja2 non-sandbox environment is unsafe as it gives
access to unsafe Python methods

Change-Id: If8a96bb92f64c4226a3d02e3cf6e0dcb0e9156fd
Closes-Bug: #1680112
(cherry picked from commit fc12891256a8192a70766449473b19fd2724a8d5)

commit_message:
Replace test.attr with decorators.attr

Function 'tempest.test.attr()' has moved to 'tempest.lib.decorators .attr()'
in Pike and will be removed in a future version[1]. This patch replaces the
'tempest.test.attr()' with the 'tempest.lib .decorators.attr().'

[1] Iaafbb112b6eee458089cc49918359a8a8d0485e2

Change-Id: I895cbb1c7de6f380d9721eadd963076cf0339c93

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger in common/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: I946422e662b5efc453bfe76f3631ece1716dbb4c
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Read XtremIO options from self.configuration

XtremIO were two reading xtremio_array_busy_retry_count and
xtremio_array_busy_retry_interval from global CONF (that is - from
[DEFAULT] section) instead of using self.configuration (which will read
from [<backend_name>] section. This prevented users from setting those
values individually for each XtremIO backend. This commit fixes this.

Change-Id: I9eb5e7a11bff9002d8c25f41c4a35600656f64bd
Closes-Bug: 1680065

commit_message:
Define extra hacking rules to ensure code quality

Enforce following codestyle rules:

* no xrange
* no LOG.warn usage (deprecated in favour of LOG.warning)
* usage of assertTrue(x) instead assertEqual(True, x)
* usage of assertIsNone(x) instead assertEqual(None, x)
* usage of assertIsNotNone(x) instead assertNotEqual(None, x)
  or assertIsNot(None, x)

Change-Id: Ib5b61816faae95937c99b1e4f651c6390b888070

This also means that bindep must be installed # separately, outside of the requirements files. deps = bindep commands = bindep test [hacking] local-check-factory = monasca_persister.hacking.checks.factory

commit_message:
Ensure ~/.config exists

The playbook that generated clouds.yaml expected ~/.config
to exist in the user's home directory, however it might not
and we need to ensure that prior to attempting to create
~/.config/openstack in order to write the file.

Change-Id: Ic37a40bc289cdf63edd6a54988831634e381e236
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/28/471328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use new env vars for tripleo yaml build

When moving from legacy build to yaml based build,
the env vars needed changed. We need to stop using the
USE_DELOREAN_TRUNK and DELOREAN_TRUNK_REPO vars, and start
using DELOREAN_REPO_URL instead, to be consumed by
the delorean-repo element.

Change-Id: Ieea596195625f5e6fb902ae8403bfe705ebedeed

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger part 8

The following directories were fixed in this commit:
  - guestagent/ (not including subdirectories)
  - guestagent/module/
  - guestagent/strategies/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ia16aca6d08524f810131c8401ea736c190f396eb
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3.

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: Ice55b84d9317e9b817e8eae3877e2f6a02ec3016

commit_message:
[Share Groups] Add two new fields to SG API object

Previous change [1] added logic for handling of availability zones with
share groups and [2] for scheduling with share group capability
to create consistent snapshots. Those two added two new DB fields
for 'share_groups' DB model, but not to API response that requires
microversion bump. So, add these fields to API and bump microversion.

Following two new fields will be available with new microversion:
- 'availability_zone_id'
- 'consistent_snapshot_support'

Also, add tempest tests to these API changes.

[1] I000adeb53fe8435465cbedc3c539e6aaae6503c5
[2] I05553c308ae40c4ddc2c6469ff1c1a3da36a87da

Partially-Implements BP manila-share-groups
Change-Id: I343d0c6f3a5c7b58d88e95dba4af984fae738954

commit_message:
Move wait_for_port_detach to common.waiters

Currently, wait_for_port_detach function resides on
compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py.
I think we should move it to common.waiters module
as other waiters functions.

Change-Id: I26e9f7e03a10965f96b2610d00c523c5ad8d35ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/468815/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def wait_for_port_detach(client, port_id): """Waits for the port's device_id to be unset. :param port_id: The id of the port being detached. :returns: The final port dict from the show_port response. """ port = client.show_port(port_id)['port'] device_id = port['device_id'] start = int(time.time()) # NOTE(mriedem): Nova updates the port's device_id to '' rather than # None, but it's not contractual so handle Falsey either way. while device_id: time.sleep(client.build_interval) port = client.show_port(port_id)['port'] device_id = port['device_id'] timed_out = int(time.time()) - start >= client.build_timeout if device_id and timed_out: message = ('Port %s failed to detach (device_id %s) within ' 'the required time (%s s).' % (port_id, device_id, client.build_timeout)) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(message)

commit_message:
Stop using abbreviation DSL in document

Sometimes people get confused when DSL is used. So, to overcome it
Mistral Workflow Language is used instead of DSL throughout the
documentation.

Change-Id: Ic7516b4f45854fd9960cef3e529dcb507439f8e6
Partially-implements: blueprint add-documentation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/25/470925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Workflow is the main building block of Mistral Workflow Language, the reason why the project exists. Workflow represents a process that can be described in a various number of ways and that can do some job interesting to the end user. Each workflow consists of tasks (at least one) describing what exact steps should be made during workflow execution.Mistral Workflow Language v2 introduces different workflow types and the structure of each workflow type varies according to its semantics. Currently, Mistral provides two workflow types:For more details about Mistral Workflow Language itself, please see :doc:`Mistral Workflow Language specification </dsl/index>`
deleted_lines: Workflow is the main building block of Mistral DSL, the reason why the project exists. Workflow represents a process that can be described in a various number of ways and that can do some job interesting to the end user. Each workflow consists of tasks (at least one) describing what exact steps should be made during workflow execution.Mistral DSL v2 introduces different workflow types and the structure of each workflow type varies according to its semantics. Currently, Mistral provides two workflow types:For more details about DSL itself, please see :doc:`Mistral DSL specification </dsl/index>`

subject: WIP: Fix race condition when neutron is using minimized poll
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 11:34:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/49bcc97ddaf5aa83903911ab633c14c0bdeceb18', 'message': "WIP: Create ovs port with other params together

When create ovs port in nova, it will first create ovs port using
one commnd and set other parameters using seperated commands, but
this isn't the correct way, because once the ovs port is created,
neutron ove agent will monitor the chagne immediately and deals
with the new added port, however, at this time, the other params
are not set in ovs, this patch is to make creating ovs port and
setting corresponding params in one operation

Depends-On: Ic7bab9fd3eeed8be3f1493716178189bcf048da1
Partial-Bug: #1649747

Change-Id: Ib5a0c66383b4aca0ee7093e67b501efa4d080aa0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-23 01:52:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/40a35a725ed61c66a5367d2e9799869e88e14a06', 'message': "Create ovs port with other params together

one commnd and set other parameters using seperated commands, but

with the new added port, however, at this time, the other params
are not set in ovs, this patch is to make creating ovs port and
setting corresponding params in one operation

Depends-On: Ic7bab9fd3eeed8be3f1493716178189bcf048da1

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-23 06:54:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4e33104ff2aaf68ff1bb5977285a6adfcc6cef82', 'message': "Create ovs port with other params together

this isn't the correct way, because once the ovs port is created,

Change-Id: Ib5a0c66383b4aca0ee7093e67b501efa4d080aa0
"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-24 09:42:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fff6cb509eef789762e2b3a6e4ed545b6f7ad4ae', 'message': "Fix race condition when neutron is using minimized poll

When enable minimized poll in neutron ovs agent in compute node,
we found sometimes the VM cannot be ping successfully and after
hard/soft reboot a VM, it cannot get its fixed IP successfully.
There are two reasons:
(1) When create ovs port in nova, it use seperated commands to
create port and set corresponding params external-ids, as a result,
neutron first noticed the port changes but without iface-id and
won't deal with the port
(2)
When creating/plugging VIF, we should only set neutron port id as
iface-id to the tap device, we should not set it in the *real* VIF
which is the one that XenServer deal with, because if we set it in
both, when rebooting the VM, neutron side can notice both changes
which is wrong

Depends-On: Ic7bab9fd3eeed8be3f1493716178189bcf048da1
Partial-Bug: #1649747

Change-Id: Ib5a0c66383b4aca0ee7093e67b501efa4d080aa0

When creating/plugging VIF, we should only set neutron port id as

Change-Id: Ib5a0c66383b4aca0ee7093e67b501efa4d080aa0

which is the one that XenServer deal with, because if we set it in
both, when rebooting the VM, neutron side can notice both changes
which is wrong

commit_message:
WIP: Fix race condition when neutron is using minimized poll

When enable minimized poll in neutron ovs agent in compute node,
we found sometimes the VM cannot be ping successfully and after
boot, it cannot get its fixed IP successfully. This is because
when create ovs port in nova, it use seperated commands to
create port and set corresponding params external-ids, as a result,
neutron first noticed the port changes but without iface-id and
won't deal with the port

Depends-On: Ib588577cd22d0d3b8cda634b82e7993571bec7e8

Partial-Bug: #1649747

Change-Id: Ib5a0c66383b4aca0ee7093e67b501efa4d080aa0

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-08 05:38:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f25c48d229e97b0f336fe8c8446212756ef91e26', 'message': "XenAPI: Deprecate nicira-iface-id for XenServer VIF

When using neutron polling mode, booting a VM will timeout because cannot
receive network-vif-plugged event. After investigation we found we set
vif['id'](i.e. neutron port uuid from neutron's perspective of view) to

VIF (which will result in 'iface-id' in ovsdb) and use 'neutron-port-id'.

commit_message:
XenAPI: Deprecate nicira-iface-id for XenServer VIF

When using neutron polling mode, booting a VM will timeout because cannot
receive network-vif-plugged event. After investigation we found we set
vif['id'](i.e. neutron port uuid from neutron's perspective of view) to
two different OVS ports. One is the Xenserver VIF, the other is tap device
qvo-XXXX which neutron ovs agent will monitor and deal with.
This patch is to deprecate the setting of 'nicira-iface-id' to XenServer
VIF (which will result in 'iface-id' in ovsdb) and use 'neutron-port-id'.
Note: There is no problem if we don't use neutron-ovs-agent polling mode

Change-Id: I878602b5a84106634a211735c0002580293e3c06

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-06 03:28:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-statsd/commit/65586aa0d4374bd8a286d32b8cf50baa5539e338', 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I8d02c971d5b906ddbf58961c8544ecbcb9d01634
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Changing Popen to .check_output because of 3 reasons:
1. check_output() will raise CalledProcessError if
the called process returns a non-zero return code.
2. For consistency with keystone [1] and cinder [2]
3. It makes the code look much better.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457142/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433081

Change-Id: I8d02c971d5b906ddbf58961c8544ecbcb9d01634

commit_message:
Remove 'sphinxcontrib.autohttp.flask' from sphinx config

* After updating Sphinx to 1.6.2 Sphinx this extension got broken
  and our Mistral "doc" CI job too
* We don't use Flask in the project anyway

Change-Id: I051ec26e155344684b69bad6a50f2162febbc928

commit_message:
Add a nova section to blazar.conf

Some config values used by novaclient are located in the DEFAULT config
section. This patch moves these config values to a dedicated [nova]
section in blazar.conf.

Partially implements: blueprint new-instance-reservation

Change-Id: Ie76dc1a5459dc6ee571ec045885416f4df345e7c

noticed by magnum which used the default one.

Use eventlet to not be affected by bug #1694728 , but more

Closes-Bug: #1694728
(cherry picked from commit bd69b3fff6b50048813360627fb02044cf1bcb58)

commit_message:
Use eventlet executor in rpc_service

The default executor of o.m is 'blocking', but after change [1],
o.m with blocking is broken. 'eventlet' and 'non-blocking' work
fine and most services use 'eventlet', so this is why it was
noticed by magnum which used the default one.

Use eventlet to not be affected by bug #1694728 , but more
importantly, the oslo team suggests to not use blocking which
has 0% test coverage and it is going to be deprecated and unset
from the default configuration.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463673/

Change-Id: I47da73787456c97f7d84fd4440404b551ff62528
Closes-Bug: #1694728
(cherry picked from commit bd69b3fff6b50048813360627fb02044cf1bcb58)

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type' argument is deprecated
in version '4.0' and will be removed in version '5.0': The argument
enforce_type has changed its default value to True and then will
be removed completely."

Change-Id: Ib6fb7f328157cc7d679839889112298580ec6ddf

commit_message:
Downloading image with --progress fails for python3

Downloading image with --progress fails for python3 with,
TypeError: 'IterableWithLength' object is not an iterator. This
is because IterableWithLength class does not implemented python3
compatible __next__ method.

Added __next__ method for python3 compatibility.

Change-Id: Ic2114180fac26e9a60678f06612be733e8671bdb
Closes-Bug: #1671365
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/04/444104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For Python 3 compatibility def __next__(self): return next(self.iterable)

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove the
usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Closes-bug: #1694616
Change-Id: I0bfda96d529ec3f8cf2691b3ffbee9df686a0fb2

commit_message:
Fix ceph instructions in multinode guide.

Removed inappropriate quotes from around kube_version in
the controller manager sed command, and clarified version
info for the controller manager.

commit_message:
Replace get_transport() calls

Using 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()' has been deprecated by
the commit Ic6af07b98ff43806c2af38a3ba129991f1e0ec86. This patch
replaces the get_transport() with the get_rpc_transport() and the
get_notification_transport().

Change-Id: If5868a9a27913dfdd5839726cf6645c4b567ecd2

commit_message:
Use eventlet executor instead of blocking executor

The default executor of oslo.messaging is 'blocking'. The blocking
executor has been broken by the patch[1]. And the issue has been
published in oslo.messaging 5.25.0.

This patch changes the executor used by rpc_server in blazar-manager.
Additionally, in oslo team the blocking executor will be removed in
the future release.

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463673/

Change-Id: I87dae619d4b89a1f2465d31a62d46de8d26f7512

added_lines: def backup_use_temp_snapshot(self): return True # NOTE(xyang): This is for testing attach snapshot only. # LVM actually doesn't need to attach snapshot because # the snapshot can be accessed through local_path. super(LVMVolumeDriver, self).backup_volume(context, backup, backup_service) return def create_export_snapshot(self, context, snapshot, connector, vg=None): if vg is None: vg = self.configuration.volume_group snapshot_path = "/dev/%s/_%s" % (vg, snapshot['name']) export_info = self.target_driver.create_export( context, snapshot, snapshot_path) return {'provider_location': export_info['location'], 'provider_auth': export_info['auth'], } def remove_export_snapshot(self, context, snapshot): self.target_driver.remove_export(context, snapshot) def initialize_connection_snapshot(self, snapshot, connector, **kwargs): return self.target_driver.initialize_connection(snapshot, connector, is_snapshot=True) def terminate_connection_snapshot(self, snapshot, connector, **kwargs): return self.target_driver.terminate_connection(snapshot, connector, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Remove legacy auth loading

remove support for specifying client auth in keystone_authtoken config section.
This was deprecated about a year ago and now can safely be removed.

Also, fill the [cinder] section with auth options in devstack.

Change-Id: I0c45d12d80eff45e643af29cded178644071c9fe

deleted_lines: from ironic.conf import authLOG = log.getLogger(__name__) SECTIONS_WITH_AUTH = ( 'service_catalog', 'neutron', 'glance', 'swift', 'cinder', 'inspector') # TODO(pas-ha) remove this check after deprecation period def _check_auth_options(conf): missing = [] for section in SECTIONS_WITH_AUTH: if not auth.load_auth(conf, section): missing.append('[%s]' % section) if missing: link = "http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/newton.html" LOG.warning("Failed to load authentification credentials from " "%(missing)s config sections. " "The corresponding service users' credentials " "will be loaded from [%(old)s] config section, " "which is deprecated for this purpose. " "Please update the config file. commit_message:
Change an executor option for the RPC server

The change I62b9e09513e3ebfebc64a941d4b21b6c053b511d in the
oslo.messaging broke the 'blocking' executor. This patch changes the
executor to 'eventlet'. This change may be better to be reverted
after the problem in oslo.messagin is solved.

Change-Id: I3634b7ce7ebc43f69be60e2ad18540e7805634e6

commit_message:
[Share Groups] Add availability zone support

'Share groups' feature was not finished completely in Ocata timeframe.
There was absent possibility to specify 'availability zone' for
creation of a share group. So, implement it.
The fact of its implementation fixes mentioned bug below.

Closes-Bug: #1662944
Partially-Implements BP manila-share-groups

Change-Id: I000adeb53fe8435465cbedc3c539e6aaae6503c5

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 01:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/account/test_server.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/8d6eb3677958245d71682d83ac621ac3fe6d00a0', 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: I5b5900c509956cf13ec3d1f2105fc7c89531f22a
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: I5b5900c509956cf13ec3d1f2105fc7c89531f22a

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger part 10

The following directories were fixed in this commit:
  - module/
  - quota/
  - taskmanager/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Iabfb6e8caeae3afe057b77315f26f9fdcaffda54
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Remove usage of parameter enforce_type

Oslo.config deprecated parameter enforce_type and change its default
value to True in Ifa552de0a994e40388cbc9f7dbaa55700ca276b0. Remove the
usage of it to avoid DeprecationWarning: "Using the 'enforce_type'
argument is deprecated in version '4.0' and will be removed in version
'5.0': The argument enforce_type has changed its default value to True
and then will be removed completely."

Related-Bug: #1517839
Change-Id: Id7b17a4e715a54a52bcae0e60cb40028cbd85f5d

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger part 9

The following directories were fixed in this commit:
  - guestagent/backup
  - guestagent/datastore

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: I437ffa2d3d6f756c6af1f6b94781b3f03a83814f
Related-Bug: #1642552

interpolated by the logger.

commit_message:
Check keepalived health in the amphora

The health manager did not detect a keepalived failure inside the amphora.
This patch will not send a health heartbeat if keepalived is configured but
not running.

This patch also allows the health checks to continue after an initial failure.

Change-Id: Id21310bd5ded3747218d3872ab3c966e5ddf5356
Closes-Bug: #1695090

commit_message:
remove CLUSTER_DELETE from batch-policy

Batch policy will not support CLUSTER_DELETE action anymore.

Change-Id: I28be68277b21625373d421703e157a87e1bdad93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/55/470655/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_batch_size(self, total): """Get batch size for update operation. # if the number of nodes less than min_in_service, # we divided it to 2 batches if total > self.min_in_service: plan['plan'] = [] batch_size, batch_num = self._get_batch_size(len(nodes)) # for updating pd['update'] = value
deleted_lines: ('BEFORE', consts.CLUSTER_DELETE), def _get_batch_size(self, total, action): """Get batch size for update/delete operation. :param action: Name of action being executed. # if the action is CLUSTER_DELETE or number of nodes less than # min_in_service, we divided it to 2 batches if (action == consts.CLUSTER_UPDATE and total > self.min_in_service): action_name = action.action if action_name == consts.CLUSTER_UPDATE: plan['plan'] = [] return True, plan else: plan['batch_size'] = 0 return True, plan batch_size, batch_num = self._get_batch_size(len(nodes), action_name) if action_name == consts.CLUSTER_DELETE: plan['batch_size'] = batch_size # for updating and deleting if action.action == consts.CLUSTER_UPDATE: pd['update'] = value else: pd['delete'] = value

commit_message:
Enrich the cluster enable_root error message

Now we have three types of enable_root cluster, can directly
enable_root cluster, need password can enable_root cluster
and can not enable_root operation of the cluster.
For example, a galera cluster requires a password to enable_root,
but the error message is not clear.Lead to great extent, Resulting
in a large extent mistaken for galera can not enable_root operation,
so we need to enrich the error message.

result:trove root-enable  88740f01-324e-4a66-962b-20061ce022ee
ERROR: The 'enable_root' operation is not supported for current cluster
without password.please try to enable root with password (HTTP 400)
Change-Id: Ifeeaeeae0694f359a070cec1dfeb16814e0c3e1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/04/422404/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: password = DefaultRootController._get_password_from_body(body) if is_cluster: if password: raise exception.ClusterOperationNotSupported( operation='enable_root') else: raise exception.ClusterOperationNotSupported( operation='enable_root', msg="without password.please try to enable root " "with password")
deleted_lines: if is_cluster: raise exception.ClusterOperationNotSupported( operation='enable_root') password = DefaultRootController._get_password_from_body(body)

commit_message:
Reset the _TRAITS_SYNCED global in Traits tests

The global is reset before and after tests because we don't know
what other tests might have been messing with it (without even
knowing) in this process. We want to start from a clean slate and
leave the slate clean.

Change-Id: I42b9a7973ec5c4f42578779dc6ad59274212113f
Closes-Bug: #1696267

subject: Router update should not touch nonexistent local router
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-26 02:56:54.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/central_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tricircle/commit/6c227a18bc512a19611f2ee43ebb9772ea68f17c', 'message': "Router update should not touch nonexistent local router

1. What is the problem
Set external gateway to a router, if error occurs during local router
creating/updating, exception will be raised, but this time central
router is already updated with external gateway information. So when we
try to unset the external gateway, central Neutron server will try to
remove external gateway for local router first, if local router doesn't
exist at this time, we have no way to unset the external gateway since
we fail to remove external gateway for local router.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Do not try to remove external gateway for a nonexistent local router.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
N/A

Change-Id: Id7261640405d4d24c8523f6518ec19edc031024b
Closes-Bug: #1693138
"}]
commit_message:
Router update should not touch nonexistent local router

1. What is the problem
Set external gateway to a router, if error occurs during local router
creating/updating, exception will be raised, but this time central
router is already updated with external gateway information. So when we
try to unset the external gateway, central Neutron server will try to
remove external gateway for local router first, if local router doesn't
exist at this time, we have no way to unset the external gateway since
we fail to remove external gateway for local router.

2. What is the solution for the problem
Do not try to remove external gateway for a nonexistent local router.

3. What features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to
realize the solution
N/A

Change-Id: Id7261640405d4d24c8523f6518ec19edc031024b
Closes-Bug: #1693138

commit_message:
[Generic driver] Fix incompatibility with novaclient

Novaclient has removed lots of proxies to other clients such as
'images' [1], 'networks' [2] and 'security_groups' [3].
So, fix incompatibilities the way we can work with old and
new novaclient versions.

[1] I2d9fd0243d42538bd1417a42357c17b09368d2a5
[2] I8c520100a0016eed3959619c71dae037ebd72939
[3] I6fa14f43d48f1e035ef54bd2d0078506f0c6d6e0

Change-Id: Id7383329b2491f76579f042cbed06585c2214815
Closes-Bug: #1691445

commit_message:
Move user policies to DocumentedRuleDefault

A new policy class was introduce that requires
additional parameters when defining policy objects.

This patch switches our user policy object to
the policy.DocumentedRuleDefault and fills the
required policy parameters as needed.

Change-Id: I22aaa4a35faa639ac2d0ad5a0d47802c3a620043
Partially-Implements: bp policy-docs

commit_message:
Using assertIsNotNone(xxx) instead of assertNotEqual(None, xxx)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNotNone(xxx) is preferred over
assertNotEqual(None, xxx) or assertIsNot(None, xxx).

This patch is to replace assertNotEqual(None, xxx) with
assertIsNotNone(xxx), also relevant hacking rule is added.

Change-Id: I715881d0a6e044f7e8570cb13f03dde3fb9d7482

commit_message:
Manage access project for nova flavors

Add a new 'project' parameter to nova_flavor.
This way we can manage to create flavors for specific tenants /
projects.

Change-Id: Ib2fcc4d73557c199d1b1e7d744f64a335d5b17f4
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Replace messaging.get_transport with get_rpc_transport

The get_transport method was deprecated in the oslo.messaging
5.24.2 release in favor of get_rpc_transport and
get_notification_transport. We are already using get_notification_transport,
we just need to change to use get_rpc_transport.

Change-Id: Ie276fedef35f411cafbaf25c2148fea42ae01410

subject: Enable url lookup without a proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-20 13:15:11.000000000', 'files': ['lookup/url.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins/commit/2005b8e26045803a8cb2f1724492403df296ceea', 'message': 'Enable url lookup without a proxy

When proxy access to internet resources is required,
if openstack_repo_url is set to https to align with the haproxy_ssl
settings.
The following error were seen when using lookup to verify the checksum.
<urlopen error Tunnel connection failed: 403 Forbidden>

If openstack_repo_url is set to http, occasionaly a checksum mismatch
is seen. Even the no_proxy variable has included the loadbalancer vip
dns name.

By introducing a use_proxy parameter to url lookup, the usage of proxy
is totally controllable.

Change-Id: I9c59d2d44fea4a3cf06b77fb97a87efc64dd62f4
'}]
commit_message:
Enable url lookup without a proxy

When proxy access to internet resources is required,
if openstack_repo_url is set to https to align with the haproxy_ssl
settings.
The following error were seen when using lookup to verify the checksum.
<urlopen error Tunnel connection failed: 403 Forbidden>

If openstack_repo_url is set to http, occasionaly a checksum mismatch
is seen. Even the no_proxy variable has included the loadbalancer vip
dns name.

By introducing a use_proxy parameter to url lookup, the usage of proxy
is totally controllable.

Change-Id: I9c59d2d44fea4a3cf06b77fb97a87efc64dd62f4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-plugins refs/changes/98/458498/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (c) 2015, Brian Coca <bcoca@ansible.com> # # This file is part of Ansible # # Ansible is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify # it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by # the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or # (at your option) any later version. # # Ansible is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, # but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of # MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the # GNU General Public License for more details. # # You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License # along with Ansible. If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. from __future__ import (absolute_import, division, print_function) __metaclass__ = type from ansible.compat.six.moves.urllib.error import HTTPError, URLError from ansible.errors import AnsibleError from ansible.module_utils._text import to_text from ansible.module_utils.urls import open_url, ConnectionError, SSLValidationError from ansible.plugins.lookup import LookupBase try: from __main__ import display except ImportError: from ansible.utils.display import Display display = Display() class LookupModule(LookupBase): def run(self, terms, variables=None, **kwargs): validate_certs = kwargs.get('validate_certs', True) use_proxy = kwargs.get('use_proxy', False) ret = [] for term in terms: display.vvvv("url lookup connecting to %s" % term) try: response = open_url(term, validate_certs=validate_certs, use_proxy=use_proxy) except HTTPError as e: raise AnsibleError("Received HTTP error for %s : %s" % (term, str(e))) except URLError as e: raise AnsibleError("Failed lookup url for %s : %s" % (term, str(e))) except SSLValidationError as e: raise AnsibleError("Error validating the server's certificate for %s: %s" % (term, str(e))) except ConnectionError as e: raise AnsibleError("Error connecting to %s: %s" % (term, str(e))) for line in response.read().splitlines(): ret.append(to_text(line)) return ret

commit_message:
Apply backward compatibility with newton

Old version of octavia requires the following options present in
octavia.conf.

[keystone_authtoken]
admin_user = octavia
admin_password = password
admin_tenant_name = service

[keystone_authtoken_v3]
admin_user_domain = default
admin_project_domain = default

Change-Id: I081a12fc38c00817fc3d11b500058bb3195e4010
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_octavia refs/changes/05/456605/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Backward compatibility with newton admin_user = {{ octavia_service_user_name }} admin_password = {{ octavia_service_password }} admin_tenant_name = {{ octavia_service_project_name }} [keystone_authtoken_v3] admin_user_domain = {{ octavia_service_user_domain_id }} admin_project_domain = {{ octavia_service_project_domain_id }}

commit_message:
Handle log message interpolation by the logger part 7

The following directories were fixed in this commit:
  - extensions/

According to OpenStack Guideline[1], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: I47b7215cd0b61c52405917ecde849a3ea1ae5e32
Related-Bug: #1642552

commit_message:
Clean up doc/ and releasenotes/

There were two Release notes information: doc/source/releases and
releasenotes (by reno). There is no need to have two different way.

It is not a good idea to have too much contents in the top page
document. Installation stuff is split into a separate page.

Title level of index.rst was inconsistent.

_static and _templates directories in releasenotes/source
are unnecessary. Also version info is set in release notes.

Change-Id: I26675254f3480330f00e210e3345c7db6ea5b2b2

commit_message:
hacking: Specify white list rules in noqa explicity

If 'noqa' is specified all hacking checks are disabled.
It is better to ignore specific rules explicitly rather than
ignoring all. The recent flake8 supports this [1].

[1] http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/user/ignoring-errors.html

Change-Id: Ic4df7f19764e304e5975385fa2cac7dc3c42c80b

commit_message:
Base image: fix formatting of rpm_distros template

The recent move to use sperate templated elements for rpm and deb
based images introduced some formatting issues. This PS tidies
things up a bit.

Change-Id: Ie60ae1f7bf2f76ee3eea8b8195bc59e9bd0b416b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 14:42:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/2c626658547628fccd9d3d076b744cf899085421', 'message': 'Remove unneeded PythonMySQL libs from OpenStack Base Image

commit_message:
Remove unneeded PythonMySQL libs from OpenStack Base Image

PyMySQL is preferred to PythonMySQL for Sqlalchemy, as it provides
python3 support and is actively maintained, and is therefore the
currently recommended lib for db connections.
 * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

Kolla already contains the PyMySQL libs in all the correct places,
in addition to the PythonMySQL libs. This commit removes these
unneeded libs from the Kolla OpenStack base image. PythonMySQL is
required by kolla-toolbox (as ansible depends upon it and the
MariaDB client), but this image already explicitly declares this
dependency already so no modification is required.

The PyPi MySQL-python is also removed from the Barbican as it was
expictly intalled here for some reason (it was possibly required at
some unknown point in history).

The MariaDB development package is not required in the source images
as PyMySQL is a pure python implementation.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I1b2dab1d60f86311249c846313979c97fa1d4852

Add Custom template path option to kolla-build

This commit adds a --custom-template-path option
to kolla-build, facilitating the use of  kolla-build by
other related projects. e.g. kolla-kubernetes

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install during tox runs

The -U option for pip install is pulling in everything from
upper-constraints, even if not needed, like cryptography,
and some of those things depend on native packages, like libssl-dev,
being defined in bindep.txt.

Change-Id: I15ebcfa732c549162f1adbb3d6f34acac64697eb

commit_message:
Enable Keystone v3 support for providers

tempest_glance_id_setter and tempest_neutron_net_id_setter were
previously using Credentialsv2_0, which do not work in a Keystone v3
environment (and that's what we should be using today).

Closes-Bug: #1633864
Depends-On: If692ea758e0cacb621b84499e27c585755ee9718

Change-Id: I95ea682064ff6365622fc31c562b42014fc52303
(cherry picked from commit 74424c4a4bbcf32dd6133ed0190515e300f2eccb)

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I9096cdf483e7024d85043e3371fdcb2d73b2d38a

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

This replaces the deprecated (in python 3.2) unittest.TestCase
method assertRaisesRegexp() with assertRaisesRegex()

Change-Id: I6a21ff29ad2a1a6e555a9ffe17ab0ea1fab14611

Helm Test: Framework & Keystone

This PS introduces 'helm test' functionaility to keystone and
provides the basic framwork for charts to use.

Partial-Implements: blueprint implement-helm-test-for-charts

commit_message:
Remove legacy v2.0 code from test_flavor_access

This removes some dead code from test_flavor_access
that was used for testing both the legacy v2.0 and
v2.1 code paths. We dropped the legacy code in Liberty
so addFlavorAccess and removeFlavorAccess methods don't
actually exist on the FlavorActionController.

Change-Id: I329ae25b1a4b4e126b7f87565923b8289994617d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/19/460719/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: l3_ha_mode: call bulk _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-02 20:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/e6c1d6dc0f80a27eba29009cf7a6bf7be3bb9c75', 'message': 'l3_ha_mode: call bulk _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be very
slow (minutes) on some setup, and that profiling data show that
a significant amount of time is spent in many individual calls
of _process_sync_ha_data to _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports for
a single interface, this change refactors _process_sync_ha_data to
call _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports only once on a list of
interfaces instead of <n> times.

Said otherwise:
- before: O(#routers) SQL queries
          (one per network of an HA interface of a router)
- after : O(1) SQL queries
          (on the set of networks with an HA interface on a router)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from minutes to around
one second, in the processing of a sync_routers call with 256 routers.

Change-Id: I3a00c8fbb245ab3b6d93bdaa97f3435570992791
Related-Bug: 1692971
'}]
commit_message:
l3_ha_mode: call bulk _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be very
slow (minutes) on some setup, and that profiling data show that
a significant amount of time is spent in many individual calls
of _process_sync_ha_data to _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports for
a single interface, this change refactors _process_sync_ha_data to
call _populate_mtu_and_subnets_for_ports only once on a list of
interfaces instead of <n> times.

Said otherwise:
- before: O(#routers) SQL queries
          (one per network of an HA interface of a router)
- after : O(1) SQL queries
          (on the set of networks with an HA interface on a router)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from minutes to around
one second, in the processing of a sync_routers call with 256 routers.

Change-Id: I3a00c8fbb245ab3b6d93bdaa97f3435570992791
Related-Bug: 1692971
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/29/470429/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
make the docs for drivefixes match the code

The validation logic for driverfixes branches requires a mapping of repo
name to SHA. Update the README to reflect the correct rules.

Change-Id: I1f77c15fa0843b4fc0975b230530d08cc2957acf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

remove send-announcements-to from independent projects

We no longer use the send-announcements-to field for anything.

Change-Id: I011900c07aac02b6d4bc80b1ec2edc118ab73a30
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support old independent releases

Don't fail when processing independent releases on branches that have
been EOLed.

Change-Id: I9fd87d5e2ac08a6bf8abcc811fb92950eb5dd7c6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
remove send-announcements-to from pike projects

We no longer use the send-announcements-to field for anything.

Change-Id: Iec0b11ced00ea06ac459ad544b1cb2db20d2892d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/30/470030/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow the vip_port_id to be slightly overloaded

Some topologies may need to use something that isn't
technically a port object. Also investigating other methods.

Change-Id: I430ded2f296c8541f1f8b3a34abca40984794e55

subject: Only run swift and keystone in swift func jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-02 19:58:19.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/swift.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/1da21cd8691840ec91a807f646380a22da846a1c', 'message': "Only run swift and keystone in swift func jobs

Previously the swift functional jobs ran a default devstack install.
This results in a cloud that works for running the swift test suite, but
require additional setup time that is unnecessary. Only install keystone
and swift as the other services aren't required in order to save job
runtime.

Depends-On: I1ace341721487e4700de308d3d5b800661210fc0
Change-Id: If169ac7c1b595c69e5800a3c88edd60547b577f0
"}]
commit_message:
Only run swift and keystone in swift func jobs

Previously the swift functional jobs ran a default devstack install.
This results in a cloud that works for running the swift test suite, but
require additional setup time that is unnecessary. Only install keystone
and swift as the other services aren't required in order to save job
runtime.

Depends-On: I1ace341721487e4700de308d3d5b800661210fc0
Change-Id: If169ac7c1b595c69e5800a3c88edd60547b577f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/21/470421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Disable all services export DEVSTACK_GATE_NO_SERVICES=1 # Add only what we want, keystone + swift export DEVSTACK_GATE_SWIFT=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_KEYSTONE=1 # Need to override default which is neutron enabled export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0 # Disable all services export DEVSTACK_GATE_NO_SERVICES=1 # Add only what we want, keystone + swift export DEVSTACK_GATE_SWIFT=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_KEYSTONE=1 # Need to override default which is neutron enabled export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=0

subject: Sync os-traits to Traits database table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-31 16:41:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e13b985fa7e415d1237365eb2a85b84c6a6c8d3b', 'message': 'Sync os-traits to Traits database

When a new version of the os-traits library is released, the
Traits table in the api database needs to be updated to reflect
those new traits. This change does that, once, the first time either
Trait.get_by_name or TraitList.get_all is called in any process that
is using those objects.

This is an alternative to I729e84ea0ff8f333a156b24b15fe4d368209d015.
The major difference here is that there is no trait cache so the
surface area of the change is much smaller.

Change-Id: Ia92a4fd20b8991c6f4b34e3546cfb22aa5ed78aa
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-31 17:26:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/aa1b0bd756649fea723ba2f1d4581c798d5aed06', 'message': 'Sync os-traits to Traits database

commit_message:
Sync os-traits to Traits database table

When a new version of the os-traits library is released, the Traits
table in the api database needs to be updated to reflect those new
traits. This change does that, once, the first time either
Trait.get_by_name or TraitList.get_all is called in any process that is
using those objects.

This is an alternative to I729e84ea0ff8f333a156b24b15fe4d368209d015.
The major difference here is that there is no trait cache so the
surface area of the change is much smaller.

The list traits test in gabbit/traits.yaml has been changed to not
assert the length of traits returned: this can now change with each
release of the os-traits library.

Depends-on: I7a3f4bb8501fc3edad43e1aae5cb6b9ef1c0b00d
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia92a4fd20b8991c6f4b34e3546cfb22aa5ed78aa

added_lines: import os_traitsimport sqlalchemy as sa def tearDown(self): """Reset the _TRAIT_SYNC boolean so it doesn't interfere.""" super(ResourceProviderTraitTestCase, self).tearDown() if rp_obj._TRAIT_SYNC: rp_obj._TRAIT_SYNC = False def _assert_traits_in(self, expected_traits, traits_objs): traits = [] for obj in traits_objs: traits.append(obj.name) for expected in expected_traits: self.assertIn(expected, traits) self._assert_traits_in(trait_names, self._assert_traits_in(['CUSTOM_TRAIT_C'], def test_sync_standard_traits(self): """Tests that on a clean DB, we have zero traits in the DB but after list all traits, os_traits have been synchronized. """ std_traits = os_traits.get_traits() conn = self.api_db.get_engine().connect() def _db_traits(conn): sel = sa.select([rp_obj._TRAIT_TBL.c.name]) return [r[0] for r in conn.execute(sel).fetchall()] self.assertEqual([], _db_traits(conn)) all_traits = [trait.name for trait in objects.TraitList.get_all(self.context)] self.assertEqual(set(std_traits), set(all_traits)) # confirm with a raw request self.assertEqual(set(std_traits), set(_db_traits(conn)))

commit_message:
GPFS: Fix forceful delete for consistency group

This patch fix the force delete for a consistency group
when the backend object (fileset) doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I81c4fc8fd913be11d88dcbcdd38dde88144af8bd
Closes-bug: #1694189
(cherry picked from commit 49932bbd34fb56fb187eaac525fcc8a1f46203d2)

commit_message:
List swift and keystone in feature.yaml

This lists swift and keystone as configurations in the features.yaml
file so that they can be toggled on using DEVSTACK_GATE_SWIFT and
DEVSTACK_GATE_KEYSTONE variables. When paired with
DEVSTACK_GATE_NO_SERVICES this allows us to easily only turn on keystone
and swift for swift functional testing.

This isn't strictly necessary but makes the swift functional test jobs
run much quicker.

Change-Id: I1ace341721487e4700de308d3d5b800661210fc0

commit_message:
Add pool commands to client

This patch implements pool create, list,
show, set, and delete within the openstack client.

Change-Id: I08852b0e612ef8cd9e501c6de4d45f546374ccda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-octaviaclient refs/changes/92/461992/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # """Pool action implementation""" from cliff import lister from osc_lib.command import command from osc_lib import utils from octaviaclient.osc.v2 import constants as const from octaviaclient.osc.v2 import utils as v2_utils class CreatePool(command.ShowOne): """Create a pool""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreatePool, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'loadbalancer', metavar='<load_balancer>', help="Loadbalncer to add to pool (name or ID)" ) parser.add_argument( '--name', metavar='<name>', help="New pool name" ) parser.add_argument( '--description', metavar='<description>', help="Set pool description" ) parser.add_argument( '--protocol', metavar='<protocol>', required=True, help="Set protocol" ) parser.add_argument( '--listener', metavar='<listener>', help="Listener to add to pool (name or ID)" ) parser.add_argument( '--lb-algorithm', metavar='<lb-algorithm>', required=True, help="Load balancing algorithm to use" ) parser.add_argument( '--protocol-port', metavar='<port>', required=True, help="Set listener protocol port" ) parser.add_argument( '--project', metavar='<project>', help="Project ID for the load balancer" ) admin_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() admin_group.add_argument( '--enable', action='store_true', default=True, help="Enable listener (default)" ) admin_group.add_argument( '--disable', action='store_true', default=None, help="Disable listener" ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): rows = const.POOL_ROWS attrs = v2_utils.get_pool_attrs(self.app.client_manager, parsed_args) body = {"pool": attrs} data = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_create( json=body) formatters = {'Loadbalancers': v2_utils.format_list, 'Members': v2_utils.format_list, 'Listeners': v2_utils.format_list} return (rows, (utils.get_dict_properties( data['pool'], rows, formatters=formatters))) class DeletePool(command.Command): """Delete a listener""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(DeletePool, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'pool', metavar="<pool>", help="Pool to delete (name or ID)" ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): pool_id = v2_utils.get_resource_id( self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_list, 'pool', parsed_args.pool) data = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_delete( pool_id=pool_id) return data class ListPool(lister.Lister): """List listeners""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ListPool, self).get_parser(prog_name) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): columns = const.POOL_COLUMNS data = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_list() formatters = {'Loadbalancers': v2_utils.format_list, 'Members': v2_utils.format_list, 'Listeners': v2_utils.format_list} return (columns, (utils.get_dict_properties( s, columns, formatters=formatters) for s in data)) class ShowPool(command.ShowOne): """Show the details of a single listener""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(ShowPool, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'pool', metavar='<pool>', help='Name or UUID of the pool' ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): rows = const.POOL_ROWS pool_id = v2_utils.get_resource_id( self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_list, 'pool', parsed_args.pool) data = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_show( pool_id=pool_id, ) formatters = {'Loadbalancers': v2_utils.format_list, 'Members': v2_utils.format_list, 'Listeners': v2_utils.format_list} return (rows, (utils.get_dict_properties( data, rows, formatters=formatters))) class SetPool(command.Command): """Update a listener""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(SetPool, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'pool', metavar="<pool>", help="Pool to update (name or ID)" ) parser.add_argument( '--name', metavar='<name>', help="New pool name" ) parser.add_argument( '--description', metavar='<description>', help="Set pool description" ) parser.add_argument( '--protocol', metavar='<protocol>', help="Set protocol" ) parser.add_argument( '--loadbalancer', metavar='<load_balancer_id>', help="Loadbalncer to add to pool" ) parser.add_argument( '--listener', metavar='<load_balancer_id>', help="Listener to add to pool" ) parser.add_argument( '--lb-algorithm', metavar='<lb-algorithm>', help="Load balancing algorithm to use" ) parser.add_argument( '--protocol-port', metavar='<port>', help="Set protocol port" ) admin_group = parser.add_mutually_exclusive_group() admin_group.add_argument( '--enable', action='store_true', default=None, help="Enable listener (default)" ) admin_group.add_argument( '--disable', action='store_true', default=None, help="Disable listener" ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): attrs = v2_utils.get_pool_attrs(self.app.client_manager, parsed_args) pool_id = v2_utils.get_resource_id( self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_list, 'pool', parsed_args.pool) del attrs['pool_id'] body = {'pool': attrs} data = self.app.client_manager.load_balancer.pool_set( pool_id, json=body) return data
